alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 10:11PM CDT until May 16 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Sandies Creek Near Westhoff affecting DeWitt County. San Antonio River at Hwy 72 nr Runge affecting Karnes and Goliad Counties. Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Sandies Creek Near Westhoff. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Major lowland flooding from the headwaters southeast of Seguin to the Guadalupe River confluence near Cuero. The flow is over one half mile wide. Livestock are cut off and potentially drowned in low areas of the flood plain. Roads and low bridges near the creek are flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Sunday was 25.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning and continue falling to 10.9 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.9 feet on 06/05/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Sandies Creek Westhoff 21.0 24.7 Sun 9 pm CDT 23.1 18.4 15.4 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1015 AM CDT.
